intro: Puneeria coagulans, commonly known as the coagulant plant, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and lobed leaves. The plant is notable for its ability to produce a coagulant substance, which has been traditionally used in the processing of oils and other industrial applications. It typically grows in dry, arid environments and is often found in wastelands and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and economic contexts.
